snippet: The Supreme Court acted in 2010 and 2012 to curtail the use of mandatory life sentences for juveniles, but experts say most states have taken half-measures to carry out the rulings.
abstract: Youth advocates and legal experts say many states have only taken half-measures to carry out Supreme Court rulings demanding that mandatory life sentences for juveniles be curtailed; lawsuits filed in states across the country reveal how local courts are still sentencing juveniles to staggeringly long prison terms, despite assertion by many critics that long sentences will prevent any chance at release after rehabilitation.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court acted in 2010 and 2012 to curtail the use of mandatory life sentences for juveniles, but experts say most states have taken half-measures to carry out the rulings.

headline.main: Juveniles Facing Lifelong Terms Despite Rulings
headline.print_headline: Juveniles Facing Lifelong Terms Despite Rulings
